dirsync.directory
Class DirectoryLister

java.lang.Object
  dirsync.directory.DirectoryLister

public class DirectoryLister
extends java.lang.Object

Lists the contents of a directory. Has methods to count how many files and directories are in a given directory and to list these files and dirctories (recursive, non recursive).

Author:
E. Gerber , F. Gerbig (fgerbig@users.sourceforge.net)

File[] The files.

listFiles

public java.io.File[] listFiles(java.lang.String[] includes,
                                java.lang.String[] excludes,
                                boolean printExcluded)
Lists all files (no directories) that match the include and don't match the exclude patterns.

Parameters:
includes - The patterns to include.
excludes - The patterns to exclude.
printExcluded - If set to true excluded files are printed.
Returns:
File[] The files.

listDirectories

public java.io.File[] listDirectories(java.lang.String[] includes,
                                      java.lang.String[] excludes,
                                      boolean printExcluded)
Lists all directories (no files) that match the include and don't match the exclude patterns.

Parameters:
includes - The patterns to include.
excludes - The patterns to exclude.
printExcluded - If set to true excluded directories are printed.
Returns:
File[] The files.

matchDependingOnOS

public static boolean matchDependingOnOS(java.lang.String a,
                                         java.lang.String b)
Compares two Strings depending on the operating system (If the OS is MS Windows the comparison i done case insensitive). This comparison is used to match file and directory patterns to files and directories.

Parameters:
a - The first string.
b - The second string.
Returns:
true if the strings match, false otherwise.

countFiles

public int countFiles(boolean recursive)
Counts the number of files (not directories) in the directory and it's subdirectories.

Parameters:
recursive - Whether the counting shall be done recursively.
Returns:
Number of files in the directory and it's subdirectories.
